Title: China’s Guangdong Energy agrees 1.5 mtpa LNG term deal with Next Decade
Description: Chinese utility firm Guangdong Energy Group has signed a binding initial agreement for the supply of 1.5 mtpa of LNG with US project developer Next Decade from its yet-to-start Rio Grande LNG export project in Brownsville, Texas.
Author: CK

Title: Indonesia’s Tangguh LNG plant offers two LNG project vessels for multi-month charters
Description: The BP-operated 7.6 mtpa Tangguh LNG plant in Indonesia’s West Papua province is offering two of its LNG project ships for multi-month charters, sparking some concerns among LNG buyers that the offer to lease shipping capacity over an extensive period could signal a cut in production and exports at the plant.
Author: CK

Title: Petronas, EGAS offer April-May LNG cargoes
Description: Malaysia’s state-owned Petronas is offering one LNG cargo that will load on May 8-9 at its PFLNG 1 floating LNG terminal through a tender that closes tomorrow, while Egypt’s state-owned EGAS is offering two cargoes loading on Apr. 1-2 and 16-17 from its 7.2 mtpa Idku LNG through a tender that closes today.
Author: CK

Title: Shell signs initial deal for long-term capacity at Brunsbüttel with German LNG Terminal
Description: Shell has signed an initial agreement with German LNG Terminal to book long-term capacity at the planned Brunsbüttel LNG import terminal, paving the way for Shell to become the terminal’s first customer.
Author: CK
